publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Oswego

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by Kathryn Johns-Masten
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: The diary covers the period between June and August of 1891. Mentions the many summer activities and events of a young lady’s life in central New York during the late 19th century.

repository.corpname: State University of New York at Oswego

accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to the public.

bioghist.p: Laura A. Stowell was believed to be a young adult who resided in Oswego County, New York in the late 19th century. Her father, Merrick Stowell, was a lawyer and judge in Oswego County. She later married and took the last name Carpenter.

scopecontent.p: The diary covers the period between June and August of 1891. Mentions the many summer activities and events of a young lady’s life in central New York during the late 19th century.

userestrict.p: Please contact SUNY Oswego Archives and Special Collections for use restrictions.
